---

**The Generation of All Things**
One generates Two, Two generates Three,
Three gives birth to all things.
Transformation never leaves body and mind.
Layer upon layer, ten upon ten—like towering mountains.
Preserve the vision of myriad deities, stacked and seated.
Mountains—symbolizing their seated forms.

**Cloud Comely and Jade Flower** at the ear gates,
*Cloud Comely, Jade Flower*—names for the hair at the temples.
Speaking of the ears residing within.
The *Scripture* says: *"Transformed spirit is called Azure Flower."*
All that is called *Flower* means to spread and flourish,
Like the blossoms of grasses and trees.

The **Red Sovereign** and **Yellow Sage** share my soul.
The **Red Sovereign**, lord of the Southern Quarter.
The **Yellow Sage**, the Central Yellow Sage.
Soul is the **yang spirit**, *po* the **yin spirit**—
Yin and yang in correspondence, hence *"share my soul."*

The *Book of Supreme Mystery* states:
*"Man has three souls—
First, the **Luminous Spirit**,
Second, the **Fetal Light**,
Third, the **Mysterious Essence**."
Constantly invoking their names
Prevents the soul from leaving the body.

**The Three True Ones** support each other at the **Chamber of the Room**,
Soul, Red Sovereign, and Yellow Sage as the **Three True Ones**—
Speaking of their mutual resonance, sharing the same breath.

**Five Battles** radiant—these are the **Seven Celestial Worthies**,
The **Five Battles**, the thirteenth star of the Northern Dipper.
Also, the *Scripture of Numinous Treasure* speaks of five directional Battles—
The *Cavern Chamber Precepts* say:
*"Preserve the Nine Worthies and Seven Celestial Worthies,
At the start of sleep, after eating—
Recite softly:
*'Five Stars open the passage,
Six Coalescences in the Purple Chamber,
Returning the Worthies, concealing the Dao,
Unlocking the Seven Stars.'"*

The **Soul’s Begetter** is **Dark Father**,
Transforming One into One.
The **Po’s Begetter** is **Dark Mother**,
Transforming Two to form the body.

**Master of My Sinews and Bones** is the **Prince**,
**Provider of My Vital Essence** is **White Origin**.
Eternal life, prolonged vision,
Ascension to the Ten Heavens.

**Sun and Moon** soar through the Six Coalescences,
The Six Coalescences—heaven and earth within.
Preserve within the body the sun, moon, and stars,
All phenomena, as clear as heaven and earth’s expanse.

**Imperial Domain at the Center of Heaven’s Gate**,
Five *cun* above the brow, one *cun* inward—
Also called the **Imperial Domain**.
The upper **Bright Hall** one *cun* is the **Celestial Court**,
The **Celestial Court** is the **Center of Heaven**.
The nose is the **Earth’s Gate** above.
Store the sun, moon, stars, and all deities—
All must reside at the **Gate**,
Below the brow’s hairline, above the nose.

The **Soul-Spirits of the Face** are all preserved.
Inner and outer heart-spirits correspond naturally.

---
**Chapter Twenty: Breathing**

Seek immortality through breathing the **Primordial Qi**,
Probe the **Flying Root**, probe the **Mysterious Luster**,
Swallow the **Five Fangs**, embrace the **Nine Dews**,
Practice the **Fetal Breath**—all are the **Qi of Heaven and Earth, Four Seasons, Five Phases**.

**The Sage and the Prince** stand before,
This is the *Cavern Chamber Precepts*.
The **Cavern Boat Official**—left is **Lord Without Merit**, also called the **Prince**.
The **Sage** directly points to those studying the **Yellow Court**.
Speaking of studying the **Yellow Court Sage**,
Then practicing the *Cavern Chamber Precepts*,
Preserving the vision of the **Prince**—hence *"stand before."*

**Crimson Crow** extends and retracts at the **White Stone Source**,
*Crimson Crow*—symbol of the tongue.
*White Stone*—symbol of the teeth.
*Extend and retract*—guiding the **saliva-essence**.
Speaking of unbroken flow of yin-yang **Qi**—hence *"Source."*

**Condense essence, nurture the fetus, transform the body**,
From whence you originally came.
Retain the fetus, preserve the essence—for eternal life.

The *True Revelations* say:
*The Mouth Precepts of the Upper Pure True Ones*:
*"Those who study the Dao must calm the heart, nurture the spirit,
Take medicines to treat illness,
Fill the brain chamber, prevent the **Dark Essence** from spilling—
Then one may preserve the spirit, refine the **Qi**,
Breathe the **Two Scenes**.
If one repeatedly engages in intercourse,
Leaking **essence** and **liquids**,
Then **Qi** becomes impure, the spirit perishes,
The **Essence-Spirit** is exhausted.
Even if one recites the *Pure Tower Scrolls*, *Golden Books*, or *Great Ultimate*—
How can they avoid non-existence?

Former masters often warned:
*'Students of the Dao—
Each act of intercourse drains one year’s medicinal power,
Two acts drain two years’ power—
Beyond this, all medicinal power is lost.
Thus, true immortals are ever cautious,
For this is the greatest taboo of life itself.'"*

**Three Qi** circulate the **Nine Passages**,
The **Three Qi**—the **Qi of the Three Elixir Fields**.
*Circulate* speaks of their orderly flow.
Harmonizing yin and yang,
The **Four Passes** and **Nine Orifices** flow freely—
No disease remains.

**Abide in Rectitude, Shelter in Oneness**—then fullness comes,
Preserve the **Rectitude**, guard the **Oneness**—
Spirit and **Qi** flourish, thus filling the Six Coalescences,
Riding phenomena and transforming.

**Gazing afar, a single heart like a star-net**,
Preserve the vision of the **Scarlet City Youthful Boy** dwelling within the city,
Like stars reflected in a star-net.

**Beneath the Golden Chamber, nothing may spill**,
The heart resides below the lungs.
The lungs govern **Metal**, their color white—hence *"Golden Chamber."*
Constantly preserving it brings eternal life.

**Extend my white hair, return to infancy**—
An inner matter.
Speaking of youthful visage, never aging.

---
**Chapter Twenty-One: The Jade Chamber**

Within the **Jade Chamber**, eight **Pure Ones** gather,
The **Upper Pure Worthies of the Jade Chamber**—
Symbolizing the skeletal frame.

**Lady of the Näihuan** stands at the center,
The *Scripture* says: *"Within the Cavern Chamber are Father and Mother,
Mother is the Lady, also called the **Dao Mother**."
*Näihuan, Cavern Chamber*—already explained.

**Long Valley** encircles the **Mysterious Domain**,
*Long Valley*—the nose.
*Mysterious Domain*—the kidneys.
*Domain and Environs*—the five **Zang** and six **Fu**.
Speaking of the **Qi** entering and exiting the nose,
Descending to connect with the kidneys,
Circulating around the **Zang** and **Fu**.

The heart resides in the **Scarlet City**—
Preserve inner and outer visions.
The **Outer Environs** are called the **Domain**.
Thus, a symbolic instruction.

**Six Dragons** scatter and fly—difficult to distinguish.
Speaking of the **Qi** of the six **Fu**,
Subtle and hidden—difficult to discern,
Must be carefully preserved.

**Eternal Life demands utmost caution in the Chamber**—
Loss of **Qi**, leakage of **liquids**,
Exhaustion of the body and brain—
Even if supplemented with **medicinal elixirs**,
Yet drained through the **tail**—
One must be ever vigilant.

chunks.translated_text:
Why does death weep the spirit?
Through recklessness in the **Chamber**—
injuring **essence**, losing clarity—
thus the spirit weeps.

Sudden disaster in the **Land of Calamity**—
the **Three Spirits** perish.
The **Land of Calamity**, the realm of death.
The **Three Spirits**, the **Three Souls**—
**Luminous Soul**, **Fetal Light**, **Gloomy Essence**.
The **Lost**, the departed.

Yet one must **inhale** and **retain the child’s essence**,
practice **breathing and exhalation**, **close the Chamber** to preserve **semen**.

The **inch-fields, foot-estates** govern life—
the **Three Dantians’ domains**, each a square inch.
By preserving the **Dantians’ methods**, life is regulated.

The **Scripture** says: *"Inch-fields, foot-estates."*
The **sixteen-foot-estate** refers to the face.
If one **decides to spill the sea** with reckless excess—
**Chamber indulgence**, unaware of restraint—
the leaf falls, the tree withers, losing its verdant hue—
symbolizing death, lifelessness.
**Qi** lost, **fluids** leaked—no longer one’s own form.
The *Sutra of the Immortals* states:
*"Close the Chamber, refine the fluids—
speak not much, spit not far.*
To do otherwise is to perish.

**Exclusively closing** to **ward off the scene** brings eternal peace—
**suppressing desire**, preserving the **sunlight’s service**.
As *Laozi* says:
*"The skilled closer needs no lock—
yet cannot be opened."*

Again, in the *Upper Clarity Purple Text of the Spiritual Scriptures*,
there is the **method of exploring the flying root**—
at dawn, bind and face the sun,
**knock the teeth nine times**,
then in secret, **incant the sun’s soul** with the **Five Emperors’ names of the Sun’s Core**:
*"Sun-Soul, Pearl, Radiance, Illumination, Concealment,
Green Reflection, Crimson Echo, Azure Child, Mysterious Flame, Fleeting Symbol."*
After chanting these sixteen characters,
**close the eyes, grip firmly**,
and **visualize the five-colored flowing clouds** approaching to envelop the body.
Thus, the **sunlight and clouds** enter the mouth—
this is called the **"Sun’s Radiance: Flying Root, Jade Embryo."**
The **Jade Embryo** is the **Water Mother**.
Facing the sun, **swallow the clouds forty-five times**,
then **swallow saliva nine times**.

**Preserve my **Dantian’s** three wondrous spirits**—
the **Dantian**, the **Upper Dantian**.

The *Great Cavern Scripture* says:
*"When the Three Primordials conceal their transformations,
the Three Officials are formed."*

The **Three Qi** circulate through the **Nine Passages**—
the **Three Qi** of the **Three Dantians**.
**Circulating right**, in orderly sequence—
harmonizing **yin** and **yang**,
the **Four Gates** and **Nine Orifices** flow clear,
unobstructed, free of illness.

**Abiding in Oneness, discarding excess**, brings fullness—
**preserving the True**, **nurturing the One**,
spirit and **qi** flourish—
thus filling the **Six Extremes**, transforming with all things.

**Gazing afar**, the **One Heart** like stars through silk—
**visualizing the Vermilion City’s child** residing within,
as stars reflected in a **wheel’s hub**.

Beneath the **Golden Chamber**, nothing may be spilled—
the **heart** resides below the **lungs**.
The **lungs** govern **Metal**, their hue **white**—
thus the **Golden Chamber**.
To always preserve it brings **eternal life**.

**Extend my white hair**, returning to infancy—
an inner affair—
**youthful visage**, never aging.

---
**Chapter Twenty-One: The Jade Chamber**
Within the **Jade Chamber**, the **Eight Purities** gather—
the **Upper Primordial’s Pure and True Jade Chamber**,
a **bone’s** symbolic form.

The **Dantian Lady** stands at its center.
The **Scripture** says:
*"In the Cavern Chamber are father and mother—*
the **Mother**, the **Lady**, also called the **Dao-Mother**."
The **Dantian**, the **Cavern Chamber**, already explained.

The **Long Valley** encircles the **Mysterious Domain**—
the **Long Valley**, the **nose**.
The **Mysterious Domain**, the **kidneys**.
The **Environs**, the **Five Zang and Six Fu**.
Speaking of the **qi** entering and exiting the nose,
descending to connect with the kidneys,
circulating around the **Zang and Fu**.

The **heart** resides in the **Scarlet City**—
**visualize inner and outer**.
The **Outer Environs** are called the **Domain**.
Thus, a symbolic instruction.

The **Six Dragons** scatter and fly—difficult to distinguish.
Speaking of the **Six Fu’s qi**,
subtle and hidden—difficult to discern,
must be carefully preserved.

**Eternal Life demands utmost caution in the Chamber**—
**Qi** lost, **fluids** leaked,
body and brain exhausted—
even if supplemented with **medicinal elixirs**,
yet drained through the **tail**—
one must be ever vigilant.

Why does death weep the spirit?
Through recklessness in the **Chamber**—
injuring **essence**, losing clarity—
thus the spirit weeps.

Sudden disaster in the **Land of Calamity**—
the **Three Spirits** perish.

chunks.translated_text:
「When the sun first rises, always practice the *Nine Strikes of the Teeth* to complete the rite, then recite the **Yin Incantation** to the **Sun-Spirit** with the five characters of **Midday**: *"珠景照韬绿映回霞赤童玄炎"*—the **Sun-Spirit’s** radiant light illuminates the **Scarlet City**, casting emerald reflections and crimson clouds, the **Six Dragons** soaring.

After completing the incantation, close your eyes and hold firm, nurturing the **Five Colored Flows** and **Crimson Clouds** to merge with your body. Then, swallow the sunlight and crimson clouds into your mouth, calling it the **"Sunlight Flying to the Root, the Jade Embryo."** The **Jade Embryo** is the **Water Mother**. Swallow the **Crimson Clouds** forty-five times, then also pass saliva nine times through the throat.

---

**Preserve my *Níwán* (泥丸) and the *Three Strange Spirits* (三奇灵).**
The *Níwán* is the **Upper Elixir Field** (上丹田). The *Da Dòng Jīng* (《大洞经》) states: *"When the Three Primordials (三元) refine in seclusion, they become the Three Officials (三官)."*

The **Three Strange Spirits** (三奇灵) are:
1. The **Spirits of the Three Pure Ones** (太清之中三君),
2. The **Deities of the Three Elixir Fields** (三丹田之神),
3. The **Divine Records’ Spirits** (符籍之神).

**Calmly and quietly, close your eyes to inner illumination**—
this refers to **meditating on the Three Elixir Fields** as previously described.

**Things do not disturb the *Tài* (泰) and remain balanced;**
**practice the true Dao without deviation,**
**and malevolent influences will not intrude.**

**Replete with vitality, no longer old yet youthful again,**
**wild beasts dare not approach,**
**and ravenous crows dare not swoop.**
The **old become strong, the sick regain vigor.**

**Replete with vitality (殷矣), yet not engaging in worldly affairs (匪事),**
**the body remains firm and resilient (老复丁).**

**Refine the *Yùshū* (玉书) into the **Upper Pure Realm** (上清).**
**Concentrate on the inner landscape,**
**and you shall gain the **Way of the Immortal** (仙道).

**Always recite the *Second Twenty-Two* (章第二十二) and**
**meditate on the **Three Chambers** (三房) to achieve mutual penetration.**
The **Three Chambers** are the **Chambers of the Hall of Light (明堂), the Cave Chamber (洞房), and the Elixir Field (丹田).**
They connect with the **Flowing Pearl (流珠), Jade Emperor (玉帝), Celestial Court (天庭), Supreme Truth (极真), Mystic Elixir (玄丹), Níwán (泥丸), and the Great Sovereign (太皇)**—
**all harmonize above, below, left, and right.**

**Understanding the vision sees no distinction between inner and outer;**
**meditating on the Elixir Field (丹田),**
**three times three makes nine (三三如九),**
**uniting into one (合为一),**
**illuminating and penetrating with clarity—**
**no longer any inner or outer.**

**Rinsing and storing the **Five Teeth’s qi** (五牙) prevents hunger and thirst.**
The *Língbǎo* (《灵宝》) contains a method of **serving and refining the Five Teeth’s qi.**
The **Five Teeth’s qi** are the **vital breaths of the Five Phases (五行),**
**aligned with the **original essences of the Zang** (五脏元精).
The **classic** states:
*"On the day of the **Spring Equinox** (立春), when the geese’s cry resounds,*
**enter your chamber facing east, bow nine times,*
**sit upright, and strike your teeth nine times.**
**Meditate on the **Nine Thousand Million Celestial Officials** (九千万人) of **Bùfāng Ānbǎohuálín Qīnglíng Shǐlǎo Dìjūn** (束方安宝华林青灵始老帝君),*
**descending into your room in dense clouds,*
**covering your body as if with mist,*
**entering through your mouth and descending straight to the liver.*
**Incantation:**
*'Nine Breaths of the Celestial Officials of the **Azure Sky’s Primordial Sovereign** (青天元始上精皇老尊神),*
**clad in green feathered robes,*
**commanding the **Celestial Officials** (天官),*
**illuminating the **Year Star** (岁星),*
**scattering brilliance and spreading fragrance,*
**nourishing my form.*
**I consume the **morning dew** (朝霞),*
**refining the **Wood Essence** (木精).*
**I firmly cultivate the **Azure Tooth’s qi** (青牙),*
**preserving and stabilizing the **decaying and withering** (朽零).*
**The liver is filled to capacity,*
**the **Jade Cauldrons** (玉芝) grow spontaneously,*
**prolonging life and halting aging,*
**restoring the complexion to childlike radiance.*
**The Five Breaths blend harmoniously,*
**the heavens and earth merge eternally.'*

**Afterward, draw the **Azure Breath** (青气) nine times through the throat,*
**then refine the **Crimson Scripture of Jade Text** (赤书玉文十二字).**
**The remaining methods for the **Southern, Western, Northern, and Central Directions** (南方、西方、北方、中央)**
**follow the *Língbǎo* (《灵宝》) method of serving and refining the Five Teeth’s qi.**

**The **Divine Light** (神华) holds the **Six Ding** (六丁) in reverence.**
The **Divine Light** (神华), as the *Yù Lì Jīng* (《玉历经》) states,
**is the **Jade Maiden of the Great Yin’s Mystic Light** (太阴玄光玉女),**
**the **Mother of the Dao** (道之母).
**She wears a **Five-Colored Vermilion Robe** (五色朱衣),**
**above the **spleen** (脾腑), beneath the **Yellow Cloud Canopy** (黄云华盖).**

The **Six Ding** (六丁) are the **Six Ding Yin Spirits of the Jade Maiden** (六丁阴神玉女).
The *Lǎojūn Liùjiǎ Fú Tú* (《老君六甲符图》) states:
**The *Dingmǎo* (丁卯) Spirit oversees **Mǎ Qīng** (马卿) and the Jade Maiden, who **controls the sun’s movement** (足日之).**
**The *Dīngchǒu* (丁丑) Spirit oversees **Zhào Zǐ** (赵子) and the Jade Maiden, who **harmonizes the breath** (顺气).**
**The *Dīnghài* (丁亥) Spirit oversees **Zhāng Wéntōng** (张文通) and the Jade Maiden, who **is named *Cáo Piāo* (曹漂) and governs the liver** (之).**
**The *Dīngyǒu* (丁酉) Spirit oversees **Zāng Wén Gōng** (臧文公) and the Jade Maiden, who **brings joy** (得喜).**
**The *Dīngwèi* (丁未) Spirit oversees **Shí Shù** (石叔) and the Jade Maiden, who **lodges in defense** (寄防).**
**The *Dīngjǐ* (丁巳) Spirit oversees **Cuī Jù Gōng** (崔巨卿) and the Jade Maiden, who **opens the heart** (开心之).**

**When the method of refining the **Root’s Flight** (飞根) and**
**storing the **Five Teeth’s qi** (五牙) is perfected,*
**you shall command the **Six Ding Spirits** (六丁之神).**

**Vigilantly guard the **Chamber of Essence** (精室),**
**never leaking recklessly.**

**Eternal Life demands utmost caution in the Chamber**—
**Qi** lost, **fluids** leaked,

chunks.original_text: 精室，谓三丹田。 上下资连而不绝，制之在心。 心即中丹田也，缓急之所由，真妄之根本也。 闭而宝之可长活。 积精之所致也。 起自形中初不阔， 调心使气，微妙无形。 三宫近在易隐括。 谓三丹田真官近在人身，隐括精气，常以心为君主者也。 虚元寂寂空中素#19， 外指事也。 素，有二说。 使形如是不当污， 使形轻冷，如悬缣素於空中也。 又云身中空虚，使如器之漆素，虚静当然。 污，谓有其事也。 九室正虚神明舍， 九室，谓头中九官之室及人之九窍。 使上官荣华，九康真正则众神之所止合也。 《洞神经》云：天有九星，两星隐，故称九天。 地有九官，故称九地。 人有九窍，故称九生，言人所由而生也。 存思百念视节度， 存念身中百神，呼吸上下，一如科法。 文云：千千百百似重山，皆神象。 六府修治勿令故， 按《洞神经》云：六府者，谓肺为玉堂官尚书府，心为绛官元阳府，肝为清泠官兰台府，胆为紫微官无极府，肾为幽昌官太和府，脾为中黄官太素府，异於常六府也。 行自翱翔入天路。 谓升仙羽化也。
chunks.translated_text:
The **Chamber of Essence** (精室) refers to the **Three Elixir Fields** (三丹田).
Above and below, they are **interconnected yet unbroken** (上下资连而不绝),
and their governance lies in the **heart** (心).
The **heart** (心) is the **Middle Elixir Field** (中丹田),
the source of **urgency and calm** (缓急之所由),
and the **root of true and false** (真妄之根本).
To **seal and treasure it** (闭而宝之) is to **prolong life** (可长活).
It is the consequence of **accumulating essence** (积精之所致).
Initially, it arises from within the **form** (形) without broadness (初不阔),
**refining the heart to regulate the qi** (调心使气),
subtle and formless (微妙无形).
The **Three Palaces** (三宫) lie close within the **easy-to-conceal grasp** (易隐括).
That is, the **Three Elixir Fields’ true officials** (三丹田真官) are near the body,
**concealing and gathering essence-qi** (隐括精气),
ever maintaining the **heart as sovereign ruler** (常以心为君主).

The **void and stillness of the Primordial Origin** (虚元寂寂) dwells in the **emptiness of the heavens** (空中素#19),
an **external analogy** (外指事).
"**Void**" (素) has two interpretations:
To **prevent the form from being soiled** (使形如是不当污),
or to **keep the form light and cool** (使形轻冷),
as though **hanging unadorned silk in the sky** (如悬缣素於空中).
It is also said: **within the body, emptiness and stillness are natural** (身中空虚),
making it like **a vessel’s lacquered void** (虚静当然，如器之漆素).
**Soiling** (污) means **having any affairs** (谓有其事).

The **Nine Chambers’ upright void** (九室正虚) is the **abode of the Spirit of Clarity** (神明舍).
The **Nine Chambers** (九室) refer to the **Nine Officials’ Chambers within the head** (头中九官之室)
and the **Nine Orifices of the body** (人之九窍).
To **honor the upper officials** (使上官荣华)
and **upright the Nine Passages** (九康真正) is to **unite all spirits** (则众神之所止合).

The *Tóngshén Jīng* (洞神经) states:
**"Heaven has Nine Stars** (天有九星), two hidden, hence called Nine Heavens (故称九天).
**Earth has Nine Officials** (地有九官), hence called Nine Earths (故称九地).
**Man has Nine Orifices** (人有九窍), hence called Nine Births (故称九生),
speaking of the **origins through which man is born** (言人所由而生)."

**Cultivate and reflect on the hundred thoughts** (存思百念),
**observing the nodes and measures** (视节度):
To **cultivate and reflect within the body on the hundred spirits** (存念身中百神),
**inhale and exhale above and below** (呼吸上下),
just as the methods prescribe (一如科法).
The text says: **"Thousands upon thousands, hundreds upon hundreds like layered mountains** (千千百百似重山),
all are **spirit-forms** (皆神象)."

**Refine the Six Palaces** (六府修治) and **do not let them remain stagnant** (勿令故).
According to the *Tóngshén Jīng* (洞神经):
The **Six Palaces** (六府) are:
The **lung as the Jade Hall Official, Minister of State** (肺为玉堂官尚书府),
the **heart as the Vermilion Official, Palace of Original Yang** (心为绛官元阳府),
the **liver as the Cool and Pure Official, Blue Gallery Palace** (肝为清泠官兰台府),
the **gallbladder as the Purple Darkness Official, Palace of the Boundless** (胆为紫微官无极府),
the **kidneys as the Profound Bright Official, Palace of Great Harmony** (肾为幽昌官太和府),
and the **spleen as the Central Yellow Official, Palace of Great Purity** (脾为中黄官太素府),
**distinct from the common Six Palaces** (异於常六府).

Then **ascend in soaring flight along the Heavenly Path** (行自翱翔入天路).
That is, **to transcend and become immortal** (谓升仙羽化).

chunks.original_text: 治生章第二十三 治生之道了不烦， 无为清简，约以守志。 但修洞玄与玉篇， 洞玄，谓《洞玄灵宝》。 玉篇，真文，乃#20《黄庭》也。 兼行形中八景神， 《玉讳经》云：五脏有八卦天神宿卫。 太一八使者主八节日。 八卦合太一为九官。 八卦外有十二楼，楼谓喉咙也。 脐中为太一君，主人之命也； 一名太极#21，一名太渊，一名昆仑，一名持躯#22，主身中万二千神也。 二十四真出自然， 天有二#23十四真气，人身亦有之。 又三丹田之所三八二十四真人，皆自然之道熙也。 高拱无为魂魄安， 行忘坐忘，离形去智。 清静神见与我言， 能清能静，则心神自见。 几览无外而与己言，即谓黄庭真人。 安在紫房帏幕间， 紫房幛幕，一名绛官，谓赤城中童子所安之处。 存思心神，其状如此。 立坐室外三五玄。
chunks.translated_text:
**Chapter Twenty-Third: Nurturing Life**
The Dao/Way of nurturing life is simple and unburdened—
**effortless and pure**, **frugal yet steadfast in will**.
Only cultivate the *Dòngxuān* and the *Yùpiān*—
The *Dòngxuān* refers to the *Dòngxuān Língbǎo* (洞玄灵宝).
The *Yùpiān* is the **True Scripture**, that is, the **#20 *Huángtíng*** (黄庭).

**Simultaneously practice the Eight Celestial Sceneries within the form** (兼行形中八景神),
as the *Yùhuì Jīng* (玉讳经) states:
The **five viscera house the Eight Trigrams’ Heavenly Deities and Celestial Guards** (五脏有八卦天神宿卫).
**The Eight Celestial Envoys** (太一八使者) govern the **Eight Solar Nodes** (八节日).
The **Eight Trigrams united with the Celestial Sovereign form the Nine Officials** (八卦合太一为九官).
Beyond the Eight Trigrams lie the **Twelve Towers** (八卦外有十二楼), which are the **throats** (楼谓喉咙也).

The **umbilicus is the Celestial Sovereign’s Lord** (脐中为太一君), presiding over **one’s vital mandate** (主人之命也);
it is also called the **#21 *Tàijí*** (太极), **#21 *Tàiyuān*** (太渊), **#21 *Kūnlún*** (昆仑), and **#22 *Chíqū*** (持躯),
governing the **twelve thousand deities within the body** (主身中万二千神也).
The **Twenty-Four True Ones emerge naturally** (二十四真出自然),
for **Heaven possesses the Twenty-Four True Qi** (天有二#23十四真气), and so too does the human body.
Moreover, the **Three Fields of Elixir** (三丹田) each contain **three groups of Eight, totaling Twenty-Four True Persons** (三八二十四真人),
all manifestations of **the flourishing of the Dao/Way of Nature** (皆自然之道熙也).

**Lofty and effortless, the spirit-soul rests in peace** (高拱无为魂魄安),
practicing **standing forgetfulness and sitting forgetfulness** (行忘坐忘),
**detaching from form and abandoning wisdom** (离形去智).
When **pure and still, the spirit manifests and speaks with me** (清静神见与我言),
then **one can be pure and still, and the heart-spirit naturally manifests** (能清能静，则心神自见).
The **Celestial Sovereign’s True Scripture** (几览无外而与己言) is called the **#21 *Huángtíng Zhēnrén*** (黄庭真人).
It dwells **within the purple chamber and brocade curtain** (安在紫房帏幕间),
the **#21 *Zǐfáng Zhàngmù*** (紫房幛幕), also known as the **#21 *Zǎngguān*** (绛官),
the place where **the Red City’s child** (赤城中童子) resides.
**Retain and ponder the heart-spirit** (存思心神), and its form is as described.
**Stand or sit outside the chamber for three to five breaths** (立坐室外三五玄).

chunks.original_text: 谓八景及二十四真神营护人身，则三田五藏真气调柔，无灾病也。 烧香接手玉华前， 玉华，即华盖之前，谓眉问天庭也。 百神之宗元，真人之窟宅，当仰面而存之也。 共入太室纵玑门， 《洞房经》云：天有太室、玉房、云庭。 云庭，中央黄老君之所居也。 玉房，一名紫房，一名绛官，通名明堂。 上有华盖，束西官洞通左右黄庭之内，人身具有之，如上文说。 漩玑，中枢名。 高研恬淡道之园， 研精恬淡，真气来游。 内视密陌尽睹真， 入静思存，百神森森。 真人在己莫问邻， 《玉历经》云：老子者，＇天地之魂，自然之君，常侍道君在左右，人身备有之。 何处远索求因缘。 《老子》曰：言不远也。 大道泛兮，其可左右。 黄庭内景玉经注卷中竟 #1积清成精：原作『积精成青』，据《云岌七签》及《修真十书》改。 #2文：《修真十书》本作『经』。 #3臣：原作『居J，据《云岌七签》及《修真十书》改。 #4人：《修真十书》作『元』。 #5紫：《云岌七签》『紫一上有『巾』字。 #6桃康，丹田下神名，主阴阳之事：《修真十书》作一丹田下神名桃康，主人之精胎』。 #7二：《云友七笔》无。 #8方静圆明：《云岌七签》作『方止圆动』。

then the **Three Fields and Five Viscera’s true qi** (三田五藏真气) will be harmonized and softened,

where the **brow meets the sky** (眉问天庭).
The **origin of the hundred spirits** (百神之宗) and the **True Person’s dwelling** (真人之窟宅)
should be contemplated while gazing upward.

Together enter the **Great Chamber** (太室),
pass through the **Whirling Pivot Gate** (玑门).

The **Celestial Realm** (天) has the **Great Chamber** (太室),
the **Jade Chamber** (玉房), and the **Cloud Court** (云庭).
The **Cloud Court** (云庭) is where the **Central Yellow Sovereign** (中央黄老君) resides.
The **Jade Chamber** (玉房), also called the **Purple Chamber** (紫房) and the **Crimson Official** (绛官),
is commonly named the **Bright Hall** (明堂).
Above it is the **Flower Canopy** (华盖),
binding the **Western Official’s Tunnel** (西官洞) to communicate with the **left and right Yellow Courts** (左右黄庭) within.
The human body possesses these as well, as described above.

The **Whirling Pivot** (漩玑) is the name of the **central pivot** (中枢).
**Highly refine and cultivate serene stillness** (高研恬淡) in the **Dao’s garden** (道之园),
refining essence and cultivating serene stillness (研精恬淡),
so that **true qi may come to play** (真气来游).
**Inwardly gaze into the hidden pathways** (内视密陌),

Enter stillness and ponder deeply,

The **True Person dwells within you** (真人在己),

chunks.original_text: 隐景章第二十四 隐景藏形与世殊， 学仙之士，含光藏辉，灭进匿端。 含气养精口如朱， 肌肤若冰雪，绰约若处子。 带执性命守虚元， 虚静恬淡，寂寞无为。 名入上清死录除， 得补真人，列象玄名。 三神之乐由隐居。 理身无为则神乐，理国无事则人安。 三神，三#1丹田之神也。 倏钦游遨无遗忧， 倏效，疾发也。 下文云：驾钦接生宴束蒙。 或云倏效，龙名也。 无遗忧，谓悬解。 羽服一整八风驱， 八风，入方之风，先驱扫路也。 羽服，仙服。 按《上清宝文》，仙人有五色羽衣。 又《飞行羽经》云：太一真人衣九色飞云羽章。 皆神仙之服也。 控驾三素乘晨霞， 外指事也。 三云九霞，神仙之所御也。 金辈正立从玉舆， 《元录经》云：上清九天玄神八圣，验驾九凤龙车。 玉舆、金笔，皆仙人之服器。 何不登山诵我书。 书即《黄庭经》也。 郁郁窈窈真人墟， 山中幽邃。 入山何难故踌躇， 情#2志不次。 人问纷纷臭如帑。 疾人问世不可居。 帑，币恶之帛也。 五行章第二十五 五行相推反归
chunks.translated_text:
**Hidden Landscape Chapter Twenty-Four**
Hidden Landscape Conceals Form, Distinct from the World
Those who cultivate the Dao/Way contain light and conceal radiance,
Eradicating ambition and concealing their essence.

Nurturing qi and refining essence, their lips like vermilion,
Their flesh like ice and snow, graceful as a maiden.

Bearing the nature of life, guarding the primal void,
In emptiness and stillness, serene and unconcerned, effortless and tranquil.
Their names enter the *Upper Purity Register of the Dead*—exempted,
Earning a place among the True Ones, listed in the *Mysterious Names*.

The joys of the Three Spirits arise from seclusion.
To govern the body without action brings spiritual delight;
To govern the realm without affairs brings peace to the people.

The Three Spirits—these are the spirits of the **#1** *Cinnabar Field*.

Swiftly, they roam without a trace of sorrow—*borrowed* (倏) means swift and sudden.
Below, it reads: *"Driving the swift, they meet the living at the boundless gathering."*
Some say *borrowed* (倏) is the name of a dragon.
Without a trace of sorrow means *suspended resolution* (悬解).

In one complete set of feathered robes, the Eight Winds drive forward—
The Eight Winds are the winds of the Four Directions, scouting and clearing the path ahead.
Feathered robes are the garments of the immortals.
According to *The Precious Texts of Upper Purity*, immortals wear five-colored feathered garments.
Again, in *The Flying Flight Feather Classic*, it is said:
*The True One of the Supreme Unity wears nine-colored flying cloud feathered robes*—
All are the attire of the gods and immortals.

Guiding the three pure [vehicles], they ride the morning mists—
An external reference.
The Three Clouds and Nine Mists are what the gods and immortals ride upon.

The Golden Assembly stands erect, following the Jade Carriage—
*The Primordial Register Scripture* states:
*The Nine Heavenly Dark Gods of Upper Purity, the Eight Saints, verify the driving of the Nine Phoenix Dragon Chariots.*
The Jade Carriage and Golden Pen are the apparel and instruments of the immortals.

Why do you not ascend the mountains to recite my scripture?
The scripture is the *Yellow Court Classic*.

The True Ones’ abode is deep and secluded—
Mountains are profound and hidden.
Entering the mountains is not difficult, yet one hesitates—
Emotions and aspirations are unrefined.
The world’s questions swirl like foul silk.

Swiftly, one must avoid the world’s entanglements.

---
**Five Phases Chapter Twenty-Five**
The Five Phases cyclically transform and return.

chunks.original_text: 五行，谓水火金木土。 相推者，水生木，木生火，火生土，土生金，金生水，水又生木，周而复始。 又相刻法，水刻火，火刻金，金刻木，木刻土，土刻水，水刻火，周而复始，相推之道也。 反归一者，水数也，五行之首，万物之宗。 《老子》云：道生一，一生二，二生三，三生万物。 又《易》有太极，是生两仪。 太极者，一也。 两仪，天地。 天地生万物，万物又终而归一。 一者，无二#3之称，万物之所成，终，故云归一。 三五气合九九节， 《妙真经》云：三者，在天为日、月、星，名日三光； 在地为珠、玉、金，名日三宝； 在人为耳、鼻、口，名日三生。 天、地、人凡三而各怀五#4，故日三五，其常精也。 合三三者为九官。 夫三五所怀，顺众类也。 调和万物，理化阴阳，覆载天地，光明四海，风雨雷电，春秋冬夏，寒暑温冻，清浊之气，诸生之物，不得三五不立也。 故曰：天道不远，三五复返。 三五者，天地之枢带，六合之要会，九官之气节，九九八十一为一章云云。 可用隐地回八术， 九官中有隐遁变化之法，《太上八素奔晨隐书》是日八衍。 又《太微八录衍》云：太微中有三君：一日太皇君，二日天皇君，三日黄老君。 三元之气混成之精，出入上清太素之官，能存思之，叉得长生。 伏牛幽阙罗品列。 伏牛，肾之象。 肾为幽阙。 《中黄经》云：左肾为玄妙君，右肾为玄元君。 罗品列，存思见之。 三明出华生死际， 天三明，日、月、星； 人三明，耳、目、口； 地三明，文、章、华； 是生死之际。 际音节也。 洞房灵象斗日月， 存三光於洞房。 洞房、明堂，已释於上者也。 父日泥丸母雌一， 明堂中有君臣，洞房中有夫妇，丹田中有父母。 泥丸，脑神名。 《老子》云：知其雄，守其雌。 雌、无为一也。
chunks.translated_text:
The Five Phases—namely Water, Fire, Metal, Wood, and Earth—
**Cyclic Generation:** Water begets Wood, Wood begets Fire, Fire begets Earth, Earth begets Metal, Metal begets Water, and Water again begets Wood, thus cycling endlessly.
**Mutual Conquest:** Water conquers Fire, Fire conquers Metal, Metal conquers Wood, Wood conquers Earth, Earth conquers Water, and Water again conquers Fire, thus completing the Way of mutual generation and conquest.

**Returning to Unity:** Water is the origin of the Five Phases, the root of all things. *The Laozi* states:
*"The Dao generates the One, the One generates the Two, the Two generates the Three, and the Three generates all things."*
*The Yijing* speaks of the *Taiji*, which gives rise to the Two Complementaries.
The *Taiji* is the One; the Two Complementaries are Heaven and Earth.
Heaven and Earth generate all things, and all things ultimately return to the One.
The One is without duality—all things arise from it, and thus it is said they return to Unity.

**The Triple-Five Convergence:** Three threes combine to form nine nines.
*The Miao Zhen Jing* says:
The Three—heavenly as Sun, Moon, and Stars (the Three Lights); earthly as Pearl, Jade, and Gold (the Three Treasures); human as Ear, Nose, and Mouth (the Three Orifices)—are the essence of life.
Heaven, Earth, and Man each encompass the Five, hence the Triple-Five, their eternal refinement.
Their convergence governs the Nine Officials.
The Triple-Five harmonizes all beings, regulates yin-yang transformation, sustains Heaven and Earth, illuminates the Four Seas, commands wind, rain, thunder, and lightning, and governs the seasons—spring, autumn, winter, summer, cold, heat, warmth, and chill, as well as the clear and turbid *qi*. No living thing can exist without the Triple-Five.
Thus it is said: *"The Dao of Heaven is near; the Triple-Five returns in cycles."*

The Triple-Five are the pivotal axis of Heaven and Earth, the crucial convergence of the Six Extremes, and the rhythmic *qi* of the Nine Officials—eighty-one nines forming a complete cycle.

**Hidden Earth Returning to the Eight Arts:**
Within the Nine Officials lies the method of hidden retreat and transformation—*The Taishang Baxu Benchen Yin Shu* is called the *Eight Branches*.
*The Taimi Baxu Yan* states:
Within the *Taimi* are the Three Lords: the First, the *Taihuang Jun*; the Second, the *Tianhuang Jun*; the Third, the *Huanglao Jun*.
The Three Primordial *qi* coalesce into refined essence, entering and exiting the Upper Purity *Taosu* Palace. By cultivating contemplation (*cunsi*), one attains longevity.

**The Hidden Pass of the Ox and the Mysterious Gate:**
The *Funu* is the symbol of the kidneys.
The kidneys are the Hidden Gate.
*The Zhonghuang Jing* says:
The left kidney is the *Xuanzuo Jun*, the right kidney is the *Xuanyuan Jun*.
The *Luopin Lie* appears through contemplation.

**The Three Clarities Emerge at the Threshold of Life and Death:**
The Three Clarities of Heaven are Sun, Moon, and Stars;
The Three Clarities of Man are Ear, Eye, and Mouth;
The Three Clarities of Earth are Text, Patterns, and Splendor—
These mark the threshold of life and death.
*Jie* means "node."

**The Soul’s Chamber and the Celestial Symbols of the Dipper:**
Contemplate the Three Lights within the Soul’s Chamber.
The Soul’s Chamber and the *Ming Tang* have been explained above.

**The Father is the *Nihuan*, the Mother is the *Ci Yi*:**
Within the *Ming Tang* are Lord and Subject; within the Soul’s Chamber are Husband and Wife; within the *Dantian* are Father and Mother.
*Nihuan* is the name of the brain spirit.
*The Laozi* says: *"Know the male, hold fast to the female."*
The female is the *wuwei* One.

chunks.original_text: 三光焕昭一入子室。 明白四达。 能存玄真万事毕， 《庄子》曰：通於一，万事毕也。 一身精神不可失。 常存念之，不合须臾。 高奔章第二十六 高奔日月吾上道， 吾，道君也。 《上清紫文吞日气法》，一名《赤丹金精石景水母玉胞经》。 其法常以日初出时，束向叩齿九通，毕，微咒日魂名、日中五帝字：日魂珠景照韬绿映回霞赤童玄炎飕象。 呼此十六字毕，冥目握固，存五色流霞来接一身，於是日光流霞俱入口中。 又《上清紫书》有吞月精之法：月初出时，西向叩齿十通，微咒月魂名、月中五夫人字：月魄暖萧芳艳翳寥婉虚灵兰郁华结翘淳金清莹昊黄庭内景玉经注卷下容台标。 咒呼此二十四字毕，冥目握固，存月中五色精光俱入口中； 又於光中有黄气，大如目童，名日飞黄，月华玉胞之精也。 能修此道，则奔日月而神仙矣。 郁仪结璘善相保， 郁仪，奔日之仙。 结璘，奔月之仙。 同声相应，同气相求，故二仙来相保持也。 乃见玉清虚元老， 升三清之上，与道合同也。 可以回颜填血脑。 魂魄反婴，得成真人。 口衔灵芒携五皇#5， 口吐五色云气，光芒四照，与五皇老君同游六合也。 腰带虎录佩金当， 仙人之服也。 《九真经》云：中央黄老君腰佩龙玄神虎符，带流金之铃，执紫毛之节，佩符录。 驾钦接生宴束蒙。 钦，倏效，言乘风气忽发而往。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Three Clarities Illuminating the Chamber of the One:**

The Three Lights radiantly enter the Chamber of the One.
The Four Clarities spread in all directions.
One who can preserve the Mysterious True Self shall attain all things—
*The Zhuangzi* says: *"Unified in the One, all things are accomplished."*¹

The vital essence of the single body must never be lost.
Ever keep it in mind, not for a single moment.

**Chapter Twenty-Six: High Flight**

High Flight follows the Sun and Moon—my Dao/Way ascends.
I, the Dao/Way, am the Celestial Sovereign.
*The Upper Clarity Purple Text: Method of Swallowing Solar Qi*, also called *The Scripture of the Golden Essence, Azure Elixir, and the Stone’s Mirror of the Mother’s Jade Embryo*.²

Its method is: at dawn, facing east, strike teeth nine times to awaken.
When done, softly chant the names of the Solar Spirit and the Five Emperors within the Sun:
*"Solar Spirit—Jewel, Mirror, Illumination, Concealment, Verdant, Echoing, Crimson, Infant, Mysterious Flame, Fleeting Symbol."*
Having chanted these sixteen characters, close eyes and grasp firmly,
Preserving the five-colored flowing light to envelop the body—
Thus the Sun’s light and the flowing light together enter the mouth.

Again, *The Upper Clarity Purple Text* contains the method of Swallowing Lunar Essence:
At moonrise, facing west, strike teeth ten times,
Softly chant the names of the Lunar Spirit and the Five Ladies within the Moon:
*"Lunar Spirit—Warmth, Gentle Breeze, Fragrance, Luster, Veiled, Graceful, Mysterious, Resplendent, Lingering, Pure, Golden, Clear, Radiant, Jade, Embryo, Azure, Congealed, Court’s Inner Mirror."*
³ Having chanted these twenty-four characters, close eyes and grasp firmly,
Preserving the five-colored essence-light of the Moon to enter the mouth—
And within the light, there is a yellow qi, vast as a child’s head,
Called *Flying Yellow*—the essence of the Moon’s Jade Embryo.

One who practices this Dao/Way shall High Flight with the Sun and Moon and become a transcendent.

**Idyllic Compliance and Auspicious Binding Preserve the Form:**
Idyllic Compliance is the High Flight of the Sun.
Auspicious Binding is the High Flight of the Moon.
Like sounds resonate, like qi seeks—
Thus the two transcendents come to preserve and uphold.

Then one beholds the Venerable of Azure Clarity and the Void Primordial,
Ascending to the Three Clarities’ summit, merging with the Dao/Way.

This can restore youth and replenish the brain’s vitality.
The spirit and shadow return to infancy—
One attains the True Person.

**Mouth Holding the Sacred Flame and the Five Sovereigns,**
The mouth emits five-colored clouds of light,
Radiant in all directions,
And plays with the Five Sovereigns’ Venerable Lord across the Six Extremes.⁴

**Waist Belted with the Tiger’s Scroll and Golden Pendant,**
The attire of the transcendent.
*The Nine True Scripture* says:
The Yellow Sovereign of the Central Peak wears the Dragon’s Mysterious Spirit Tiger’s Scroll,
A waist belt with golden bells,
Holds the purple-haired banner,
And bears the talisman and scroll.

**Riding the Swift to Attend the Birth Feast and Bind the Yellow Cloud.**
Swift, meaning "sudden efficacy"—
To ride the wind-qi and depart in an instant.⁵

chunks.original_text: 或云：效倏，龙名也。 束蒙，束海仙境之山也。 接生之方，与生气相接连，钦然而游其处。 玄元章第二十七 玄元上一魂魄炼， 资一以炼神，神炼以合一。 一之为物叵卒见， 一者，无二之称也。 心恬淡以得之，知得之而不可见。 须得至真始顾陌， 守真志满，一自归己。 至忌死气诸秽贱， 几飞丹炼药、服气吞霞等事，皆忌见死尸殓秽之事，此卫生家之共忌也。 然至道冲虚，本无冷秽。 未获真正，则冷秽有殊。 殊而不齐，则是非起於内，生死见於外，则清冷者生之徒，浊秽者死之徒，故为养生之所忌也。 六神合集虚中宴。 六甲、六丁、六府等诸神俱在身中，身中虚空则宴然而安乐，不则忧泣矣。 结珠固精养神根， 结珠，谓咽液先后相次如结珠。 固精，不妄泄。 神根，形躯也。 夫神之於身，犹国之有君，君之有人。 人以君为命，君以人为本，互相资藉以为生主而调养之也。 玉笆金钥常完坚， 《老子》云：善闭者，无关挞不可开。 钥，锁钥。 笑，或为匙也。 闭口屈舌食胎津， 屈舌导津液，食津而胎仙，故日胎津。 使我遂炼获飞仙。 积功勤诚之所致也。 仙人章第二十八 仙人道士非有神， 修学以得之也#6。 积精累气以为真。 有本或无此句，遂阙注#7。 黄童妙音难可闻， 黄童，黄庭真人，一名赤城童子。 妙音，谓黄庭道#8之妙音也。 玉书绛简赤丹文。 《黄庭经》，一名《太帝金书》，一名《束华玉篇》也。 字曰真人巾金巾， 真人即黄童也。 金色白，在西方，主肺。 肺白，在心上，故日巾。 《九真经》曰：青帝衣青玉锦衣，被苍华飞裙，建扶芝丹冠，巾金巾。 又元阳子曰：真人凭午，倨子，履卯，戴酉。 酉者金。 负甲持符开七门， 《老子六甲三部符》云：甲子神王文卿，甲戌神辰子江，甲申神扈文长，甲午神卫上卿，甲辰神孟非卿，甲寅神明文章。 存六甲神名，则七窍开通，元诸疾病。 火兵符图备灵关， 《赤章》、《斩邪录》，皆役使三五火兵。 又《卫灵神咒》曰：南方丹天，三熙流光； 荧星转烛，洞照太阳； 上有赤精开明灵童，总御火兵，备守三官。 即火兵三五家事也。 符者，呈八素六神、阳精玉胎、炼仙阴精、飞景黄华、中景内化、洞神鉴乾等诸符也。 图谓《太一混合三五图》、《六甲上下阴阳图》、《六甲玉女通灵图》、《太一真人图》、《束井沐浴图》、《老子内视图》、《西升八史图》、《九变含景图》、《赤界》等诸图，可以守备灵关。 灵关，即三关、四关等，身中具有之。 前昂后卑高下陈。 列位之形象也。 执剑百丈舞灵幡， 神兵幡剑之状。 十绝盘空扇纷纭， 空中作气，伟晔挥霍。 火铃冠霄队落烟， 金精火铃，冠彻霄汉。 都伍队阵，状如落烟屯云之势。 安在黄阙两眉问， 存思火兵气状，俱在天庭。 天庭，一名黄阙，两眉问是。 此非枝叶实是根。 学仙之本。 紫清章第二十九 紫清上皇大道君， 亦名玉晨君也。 太玄太和侠侍端， 太玄、太和，真仙之嘉号也。 化生万物使我仙， 道气之功绩也。 飞升十天驾玉输。 乘钦而往。 昼夜七日思勿眠， 至诚则感。 子能行此可长存， 延年神仙之道。 积功成炼非自然， 学以致其道也。 是由精诚亦由专， 守一如初，成道有余。 内守坚固真之真， 不失节度也。

「Some say: *Xióngxiào* (倏效) is the name of a dragon.
*Shùméng* (束蒙) refers to the mountain realm of the *Shùhǎi* (束海) Immortals.
The method of *Jiēshēng* (接生) aligns with the vital *qi* of birth—
One attains serene ease and wanders there.

**Chapter Twenty-Seven: Refining the Spirit and Shadow of the Primordial Void**
Refining the spirit and shadow of the Primordial Void,
One uses the refining to attain the One,
The One refined to merge with the One.
The One as a phenomenon is beyond mortal sight—
The One is the designation of the undivided.
With a tranquil mind, one attains it,
Knowing it attained yet unseen.

Only when reaching the utmost truth does one look back upon the world,
Fulfilling the resolve of the True One,
The One returns to its own.
Most forbidden is the *qi* of death and all filth,
Such as gathering *fēidān* (飞丹) elixirs, practicing *shǔqì* (吞霞) inhalation, or engaging in *shìqì* (食气) breathwork—
All these are forbidden from exposure to the dead or unclean burial rites,
A shared taboo among those who uphold *wèishēng* (卫生) health.

Yet the highest Dao is boundless and empty,
Fundamentally free from cold and filth.
Before attaining the True Way,
Cold and filth differ greatly.
Unequal yet distinct,
Then contradictions arise within,
Life and death manifest externally—
Thus, the cold and pure are the birth of vitality,
The turbid and impure are the birth of death.
Hence, these are the things forbidden in nurturing life.

The Six Spirits converge in the Void for a feast of ease.
The Six *Jiǎ* (甲), Six *Dīng* (丁), and Six *Fǔ* (府) deities dwell within the body,
And when the body’s void is tranquil, one attains serene ease and comfort,
Otherwise, sorrow and distress arise.

**Cultivating the Pearl to Nourish the Spirit’s Root**
The Pearl is formed—
Saliva gathered in succession like beads of jade.
Conserve the essence—
Do not wastefully emit.
The Spirit’s Root is the physical form itself.
As the spirit relates to the body,
So the sovereign relates to the state and its people.
The people rely on the sovereign for life,
The sovereign relies on the people as foundation,
Mutually sustaining each other as the vital principle of existence and cultivation.

**Jade Barriers and Golden Keys Ever Complete and Firm**
As *Lǎozǐ* (老子) says:
*"The adept at sealing is unopened even by the mightiest force."*
Keys are the locks of sealing.
Some say, *"Smile"* is also a key.
Bending the tongue to consume *tāijīn* (胎津),
Guiding saliva to nourish the *tāixiān* (胎仙) embryo,
Hence called *tāijīn*—
This enables me to complete the refining and attain *fēixiān* (飞仙) transcendence.
The result of diligent practice and sincere devotion.

**Chapter Twenty-Eight: The Immortal’s Way**
The Immortal’s Daoist path is not inherently divine—
It is attained through cultivation and study.
Accumulating essence and amassing *qi* to forge the True.

*"With foundation, or without"*—this phrase is omitted in the following.

**The Yellow Boy’s Marvelous Sound is Hard to Hear**
The Yellow Boy (黄童), the Yellow Court Sage (黄庭真人), also called the Red City Boy (赤城童子),
Whose marvelous sound refers to the Yellow Court Dao’s (黄庭道) exquisite resonance.
The *Jade Scripture with Crimson Slips* bears the text of the Red Elixir.

The *Yellow Court Scripture* (《黄庭经》), also called *The Golden Scripture of the Supreme Emperor* (《太帝金书》) or *The Jade Chapters of Bundled Splendor* (《束华玉篇》),
Has the inscription: *"True Person’s Perk"* (真人巾) and *"Golden Perk"* (金巾).
The True Person is the Yellow Boy.
Golden is white, located in the West, governing the lungs.
The lungs are white, residing above the heart, hence called *perk* (巾).
The *Nine True Scripture* (《九真经》) states:
The Green Sovereign wears robes of green jade brocade,
A flying skirt of azure clouds,
A crown of *Fúzhī* (扶芝) elixir,
And a *perk* of golden white (金巾).
Again, the *Primordial Yang Sage* (元阳子) says:
The True Person leans upon *Wǔ* (午), the *Jū* (倨) child,
Steps upon *Mǎo* (卯), wears *Yǒu* (酉).
*Yǒu* is gold.
Carrying armor and holding talismans to open the Seven Gates,
The *Lǎozǐ’s Six Jiǎ Threefold Talismans* (《老子六甲三部符》) say:
*Jiǎzǐ* (甲子) deity—*Shénwáng* (神王) Wénqīng (文卿),
*Jiǎxū* (甲戌) deity—*Shénchén* (神辰) Zǐjiāng (子江),
*Jiǎshēn* (甲申) deity—*Shénhù* (神扈) Wéncháng (文长),
*Jiǎwǔ* (甲午) deity—*Shénwèi* (神卫) Shàngqīng (上卿),
*Jiǎchén* (甲辰) deity—*Shénmèng* (神孟) Fēiqīng (非卿),
*Jiǎyín* (甲寅) deity—*Shénmíng* (神明) Wénzhāng (文章).
Preserving the names of the Six *Jiǎ* deities,
The Seven Orifices open freely,
Dispelling all illnesses.

The talismans and diagrams of the Fire Soldiers guard the Spirit Gates.
The *Red Chapter* (《赤章》) and *Severing Heresy Scroll* (《斩邪录》)
Both command the Fire Soldiers of the Three Heavens and Five Phases.
Again, the *Spirit of the Luminous Guard Incantation* (《卫灵神咒》) says:
The Southern Red Heaven (南方丹天), where the Three *Xī* (熙) radiate light,
The *Yíngxīng* (荧星) revolve like torches,
Piercingly illuminating the Great Sun (太阳);
Above, the *Chìjīng* (赤精) *Kāimíng* (开明) *Língtóng* (灵童) presides,
Commanding the Fire Soldiers,
Guarding the Three Officials (三官).
This refers to the Fire Soldiers of the Three Heavens and Five Phases.

Talismans are those that display:
The Eight Pure Ones and Six Spirits,
Yang Essence and Jade Embryo,
Refined Immortal Yin Essence,
Ascending *Fēijǐng* (飞景) Yellow Brilliance,
Inner Transformation of the Central Brilliance,
Piercing Spirit to *Jiànqián* (鉴乾) inspect the Heavenly Stem.

Diagrams include:
*The Three Heavens and Five Phases Mixed Unity Diagram of the Supreme One* (《太一混合三五图》),
*The Upper and Lower Yin-Yang Six Jiǎ Diagrams* (《六甲上下阴阳图》),
*The Six Jiǎ Jade Maiden Communicating with Spirits Diagram* (《六甲玉女通灵图》),
*The Supreme One True Person Diagram* (《太一真人图》),
*The Bundled Well Bathing Diagram* (《束井沐浴图》),
*The Inner Vision of Lǎozǐ Diagram* (《老子内视图》),
*The Eight Histories of Western Ascension Diagram* (《西升八史图》),
*The Nine Transformations Embracing the Brilliance Diagram* (《九变含景图》),
*The Red Realm* (《赤界》), etc.,
All of which can guard and secure the Spirit Gates.

**The Spirit Gates: Forefront Elevated, Hindmost Lowered, High and Low Displayed**
The arrangement of their stations.
Wielding a sword a hundred *zhàng* (丈) long, dancing with the Spirit Banner,
The form of the Spirit Soldiers’ banners and swords.
The Ten Absolute Ones hover in the void, brandishing swirling chaos,
Forming *qi* in the emptiness, majestic and resplendent.
The Fire Bells crown the celestial ranks, descending like mist,
The Golden Essence and Fire Bells,
Ascending to pierce the heavens.
The ranks and formations resemble the gathering of mist and clouds.
Where does one find the Yellow Gate between the brows?
Meditating upon the Fire Soldiers’ *qi* and forms,
All reside in the *Tiāntíng* (天庭).
The *Tiāntíng* is also called the Yellow Gate (黄阙),
Between the brows it is.
This is not a superficial matter—
It is the root of Daoist cultivation.

**Chapter Twenty-Nine: The Purple Clear Emperor’s Grand Dao**
The Purple Clear Emperor (紫清上皇), the Grand Daoist Sovereign (大道君),
Also known as the Jade Dawn Sovereign (玉晨君).
The titles *Tàixuán* (太玄) and *Tàihé* (太和)*,
The noble designations of the True Immortals.
Transforming to generate all things, making me an Immortal—
The merit of Daoist *qi*.
Ascending in ten days to the Ten Heavens, riding the Jade Axis.
Swiftly departing by the *qi* of sudden efficacy.
Day and night, for seven days, meditate without sleep—
Sincerity will evoke the response.
If you can practice this, you may endure eternally,
Extending years through the Immortal’s Dao.
Accumulating merit to complete the refining is not innate—
The Way is achieved through cultivation.
This stems from sincerity and also from focus,
Guarding the One as at the beginning,
Leaving ample attainment of the Dao.
Internally guarding the firm and true—
Not losing the rhythm of discipline.

chunks.original_text: 虚中恬淡自致神。 神以虚受。 百谷章第三十 百谷之实土地精， 草实日谷，阴之类也。 五味外美邪魔腥， 非清虚之真气。 臭乱神明胎气零， 胎气，谓无味之味，自然之正气也。 服气有胎息之法。 零犹失也。 那从反老得还婴？ 言不可得发白反黑，齿落更生。 此一句应在自存神之下，超此不类者。 三魂忽忽魄糜倾！ 忽忽，不恬淡。 糜倾，朽败也。 何不食气太和精， 进劝服炼之道。 故能不死入黄宁。 黄宁，黄庭之道成也。 心典章第三十一 心典一体五脏王， 神以虚受，心为柄神之宅，故为王也。 动静念之道德行， 谓念丹元童子也。 夫念为有，忘为无。 念则易心而后语，忘则灰心而神全，故道德行。 清洁善气自明光， 常念之故。 坐起吾俱共栋梁， 神以身为屋宅，故云共栋梁。 吾，丹元子也。 昼日曜景暮闭藏， 《庄子》云：其觉也形开，其寐也魂交。 交，闭也。 通利华精调阴阳。 谓心神用拾，与月相应。 华精，目精也。 心开则目开，心闭则目闭。 昼阳而暮阴，故云调阴阳。 经历章第三十二 经历六合隐卯酉， 举心之用拾，阴阳之所由也。 昼为经历，暮为隐藏。 六合，天地内上下四方。 卯酉也#9，北为暮，幽隐属也。 两肾之神主延寿， 肾神玄冥，字育婴。 配属北方，主暮夜，人能止#10精则长寿。 河上公曰：肾藏精。 转降适斗藏初九， 九、阳数也。 斗，北辰也。 北辰主阴，谓阳气下与阴合。 《易》曰：乾，吉在无首。 无首，藏也。 知雄守雌可无老，守雌，则藏九之义也。 知白见黑急坐守。 《老子》云：知其雄，守其雌； 知其白，守其黑。 皆藏九之义也。 肝气章第三十三 肝气郁勃清且长， 肝位束方。 束方木，主春，生气之本也。 清长，气色之象。 罗列六府生三光。 存想生气遍照五脏六腑，如日月星辰光曜明朗也。 心精意专内不倾， 能之一也。 上合三焦下玉浆。 言肝气上则与三焦气合，下则为口中之液。 亦犹阴气上则为云，下则为雨。 雨润万物，玉浆润百骸九窍也。 玄液云行去臭香， 真气周流，则无灾病矣。 治荡发齿炼五方。 云行雨施，无所不通。 五方，五脏也。 取津玄膺入明堂， 咽液之道，铃自玄膺下入喉咙。 喉咙，一名重楼。 重楼之下为明堂，明堂之下为洞房，洞房之下为丹田。 此中部。 下溉喉咙神明通。 身命以津气为主也。 坐侍华盖游贵京， 华盖，肺也。 肝在肺之下。 贵京，丹田也。 飘讽三帝席清冻， 三帝，三丹－田中之道君也，亦名真人。 言肝气飘飘，周流三丹田之所也。 肝气为目精，故言席清冻。 五色云气纷青葱， 肝气与五脏相杂，上为五色云也。 闭目内陌自相望， 常存念之，五脏自见矣。 使心诸神还相崇， 赤城童子与五脏真人合契同符，共相尊敬也。 七玄英华开命门， 七窍流通，无留滞也。 通利天道存玄根。 身为根本也。 百二十年犹可还， 当急修行，时不可失。 过此守道诚独难， 去死近矣。 唯待九转八琼丹， 九转神丹，白日升天。 《抱朴子》九丹论云：考览养生之书，鸠集久视之方，曾所披涉，篇已千计矣，莫不以还丹金液为大要焉。 又《黄帝九鼎神丹经》云：帝服之而升仙，与天地相毕，乘云驾龙，出入太清。 八琼，丹砂、雄黄、雌黄、空青、硫黄、云母、戎盐、消石等物是也。
chunks.translated_text:
The Void within, serene and undisturbed, naturally attains the Spirit.
The Spirit receives through the Void.

**Chapter Thirty: The Hundred Grains**
The fruits of the hundred grains are the essence of the land.
Grass fruits are called grains; they belong to the category of *yin*.
The five flavors, though externally alluring, are the temptations of demons and foulness—
Not the pure *qi* of the True Way.
Rank odors disrupt the clarity of the Spirit and dissipate the *tàiqì* (胎气).
The *tàiqì* refers to the flavor of no-flavor, the natural *zhèngqì* (正气).
There are methods of *shòuqì* (服气) that cultivate the *tàixī* (胎息).
Dissipate means to lose.

How then can one reverse aging and return to infancy?
It is not by making the hair turn from white to black or regrowing fallen teeth.
This line should follow *Zìcún Shén* (自存神), for what follows is of a different kind.

The Three Souls (*sānhún*) flutter in agitation, the Corporeal Soul (*pò*) decays and crumbles!
Fluttering means not maintaining serenity.
Decay and crumble mean ruin and decline.

Why not nourish yourself with the *Tàihé* (太和) essence and *qi*?
Advancing the method of refining and ingestion.
Thus, one may attain immortality and enter *Huángníng* (黄宁).
*Huángníng* is the fulfillment of the *Huángtíng* (黄庭) Dao.

**Chapter Thirty-One: The Heart Canon**
The Heart Canon—one body, five viscera as sovereigns.
The Spirit receives through the Void; the Heart is the pivot of the Spirit’s dwelling, hence its sovereignty.
The moral *Dao* of movement and stillness lies in contemplation.
This refers to contemplating the *Dānyuán Tóngzǐ* (丹元童子).
Thought is existence; forgetfulness is non-existence.
Thought stirs the Heart before speech, while forgetfulness extinguishes the Heart and preserves the Spirit—thus the moral *Dao* is realized.
Pure and virtuous *qi* naturally radiates clarity.
This arises from constant contemplation.
Whether seated or rising, we are all pillars of the same structure—
The body is the Spirit’s dwelling, hence the saying of shared pillars.
*Wú* (吾) refers to the *Dānyuán Zǐ* (丹元子).
By day, the sun’s brilliance; at dusk, concealment and retreat.
As *Zhuāngzi* says: When awake, the form expands; when asleep, the Souls converge.
Converge means to close.

Harmonizing the *huá jīng* (华精) smooths *yin* and *yang*.
This refers to the Heart’s Spirit gathering with the moon’s correspondence.
*Huá jīng* is the essence of the eyes.
When the Heart opens, the eyes open; when the Heart closes, the eyes close.
Day is *yang*, evening is *yin*—thus *yin* and *yang* are harmonized.

**Chapter Thirty-Two: The Circulation of the Six Extremes**
Circulating through the Six Extremes—concealing at *mǎo* (卯), emerging at *yǒu* (酉).
The use of the Heart’s gathering governs *yin* and *yang*.
Day is circulation; dusk is concealment.
The Six Extremes are the heavens and earth, the four directions within.
*Yǒu* belongs to the north, the realm of concealment and darkness.
The two Kidneys’ Spirits govern longevity.
The Kidney Spirit is *Xuánmíng* (玄冥), with the epithet *Yùyīng* (育婴).
Associated with the north, it governs night—if one can preserve *jīng* (精), longevity follows.
*Héshànggōng* (河上公) says: The Kidneys store *jīng*.
Descending to *Dǒu* (斗), aligning with the initial *jiǔ* (九).
Nine is the *yang* number.
*Dǒu* is the North Star, which governs *yin*—this is the *yang* descending to unite with *yin*.
The *Yì* says: *Bu* (乾, Heaven) attains *jī* (吉, auspiciousness) through concealment.
Concealment is the meaning of *jiǔ*.
Knowing the male and guarding the female prevents aging.
Guarding the female means adhering to the principle of *jiǔ*.
Seeing white and knowing black—urgently sit and guard.
As *Lǎozǐ* says: Know the male, guard the female; know the white, guard the black.
All are the meaning of *jiǔ*.

**Chapter Thirty-Three: The Liver’s Qi**
The Liver’s *qi* is suppressed yet surging, clear and enduring.
The Liver occupies the east, the realm of wood, the origin of vital *qi*.
Clear and enduring are the manifestations of its *qi*.
Arranged in the Six Palaces, it generates the Three Lights.
Visualizing vital *qi* illuminates the five viscera and six bowels,
Like the radiance of the sun, moon, and stars.
With focused intent, the inner Spirit remains unshaken—
This is the power of the One.
Above, it unites with the Three Burners; below, it becomes the Jade Nectar.
The Liver’s *qi* ascending unites with the Three Burners’ *qi*; descending, it becomes the saliva in the mouth.
Just as *yin* ascending becomes clouds, descending becomes rain,
Rain nourishes all things; the Jade Nectar nourishes the hundred bones and nine orifices.
The Mysterious Fluid (*Xuányè*) flows, dispelling foul odors and emitting fragrance.
True *qi* circulating eliminates disease.
It cleanses the teeth, refines the five viscera.
Clouds move, rain descends—nothing is blocked.
The five viscera are refined.
Drawing the *jīn* (津) from the *Xuán yīng* (玄膺) into the *Míngtáng* (明堂),
The method of swallowing saliva descends from the *Xuán yīng* to the throat.
The throat is also called *Chónglóu* (重楼).
Below *Chónglóu* is the *Míngtáng*; below *Míngtáng* is the *Dòngfáng* (洞房); below *Dòngfáng* is the *Dāntián*.
This is the middle region.
Descending to irrigate the throat, the Spirit becomes luminous.
Life depends on *jīnqì* (津气).

Seated beneath the *Huágài* (华盖), wandering the *Guìjīng* (贵京),
*Huágài* is the Lung; the Liver lies beneath it.
*Guìjīng* is the *Dāntián*.
Floating and dancing upon the Three Emperors’ platform, pure and cold,
The Three Emperors are the *Sāndān* (三丹)—the Daoist Lords of the *Dāntián*, also called True Persons.
The Liver’s *qi* drifts, circulating through the Three *Dāntián*.
The Liver’s *qi* is the essence of the eyes, hence the cold, clear platform.
Five-colored clouds swirl in verdant splendor.
The Liver’s *qi* mingles with the five viscera, ascending as five-colored clouds.
Closing the eyes, internally gazing—self-reflection reveals them.
Command the Heart’s Spirits to return and mutually revere one another.
The *Chéngchéng Tóngzǐ* (赤城童子) and the five viscera’s True Persons merge in harmony and mutual respect.
The Seven Mysterious Flowers bloom, opening the *Mìngmén* (命门).
The seven orifices flow freely, with no obstruction.
Harmonizing the Heavenly Way preserves the Mysterious Root.
The body is the foundation of life.
Even at one hundred and twenty years, one may still return.
Hurry to cultivate—time must not be wasted.
Beyond this, guarding the Dao in sincerity becomes truly difficult.
Death draws near.
Only await the *Jiǔ Zhuàn Bā Qiōng Dān* (九转八琼丹),
The Nine-Turned Elixir of Eight Precious Stones—white, ascending to Heaven by day.
As *Bàopúzǐ* says in *Jiǔ Dān Lùn* (九丹论):
*"Examining the books on nurturing life and collecting methods for longevity,
I have perused thousands of volumes, yet all emphasize the elixir of gold and liquid as the essence.
Again, the *Huángdì Jiǔ Dǐng Shéndān Jīng* (黄帝九鼎神丹经) states:
The Emperor took it and ascended to immortality, aligning with Heaven and Earth,
Riding clouds and dragons, entering and exiting *Tàiqīng* (太清)."*
The Eight Precious Stones are cinnabar, realgar, orpiment, malachite, sulfur, mica, saltpeter, and salt.

Day and night, for seven days, meditate without sleep—
Sincerity will evoke the response.
If you can practice this, you may endure eternally,
Extending years through the Immortal’s Dao.
Accumulating merit to complete the refining is not innate—

chunks.original_text: 要复精思存七元， 虽服神丹，兼习黄庭之道。 七元者，谓七星及七窍之真神也。 又五帝元君及白元、元英君，亦为七元道君。 《洞房袂》云：存七元者，其咒曰：回元隐遁，豁落七辰。 乃七元也。 日月之华救老残， 左目为日，右目为月。 目主肝，配东方木行也。 木位春，春为生气，故云救老残。 肝气周流终无端。 《庄子》曰：指穷为薪而火传。 生得纳养而命续也。 肺之章第三十四 肺之为气三焦起， 《中黄经》曰：肺首为三焦。 肺之为气谓气嗽，气嗽起自三焦，故言三焦起。 说三焦者多未的其实，今以为五脏之上系管为三焦。 焦者，热也，言肝心肺头，焦热之义也。 视听幽冥候童子， 童子，心神，赤城中者。

To restore vitality, one must carefully cultivate the Seven Elements—
Even with elixirs of divine potency, one must also practice the *Huángtíng* Dao.

The Seven Elements refer to the seven stars and the true spirits of the seven orifices.
Moreover, the Five Sovereigns’ Elemental Lords and the White Elemental Lord, the Elemental Lord of Splendor, are also the Seven Elemental Dao Lords.

*The Dòngfáng Mèi* states:
*"To cultivate the Seven Elements, the incantation is:
*'Return the Elements to concealment, dispel the seven luminaries.'*
This is the Seven Elements."*

The radiance of the sun and moon rescues aging decay—
The left eye governs the sun, the right eye governs the moon.
The eyes govern the liver, corresponding to the east’s wood phase.
Wood belongs to spring, spring is the breath of life—thus it rescues aging decay.
The liver’s *qi* circulates endlessly without cessation.

As *Zhuāngzǐ* says:
*"When the finger’s fire burns out, the flame passes to the kindling—
Life endures through nourishment, and thus the breath continues."*

**Chapter Thirty-Four on the Lungs**
The lungs’ *qi* originates from the Triple Burner.
*The Zhōnghuáng Jīng* states:
*"The lungs’ apex governs the Triple Burner."*
The lungs’ *qi* refers to *qìsòu* (气嗽), which arises from the Triple Burner—
Thus it is said the Triple Burner gives rise to it.

Many explanations of the Triple Burner lack precision;
Now it is understood as the five viscera’s upper conduits.

*"Jiao"* means heat—
Speaking of the liver, heart, and lungs’ apexes, it conveys the sense of scorching heat.

To perceive the unseen, listen to the child within—
The child is the heart-spirit, the one in *Chìchéng* (赤城).

chunks.original_text: 元阳子曰：窥离而下存童子。 童子是目童也。 谓人欲知死生，当以手指柱目毗，侯其目光，有光则生，无光则死也。 调理五华精发齿， 五华，五脏之气。 《仙经》曰：发欲数栉，齿欲数叩也。 三十六咽玉池裹， 口为玉池，亦日华池。 胆为中池。 胞为玉泉。 华池咽液入丹田，所谓溉灌灵根也。 开通百脉血液始。 身中血液，以口为本始也。 颜色生光金玉泽， 百节开通。 齿坚发黑不知白， 反老还婴。 存此真神勿落落， 斗专诚不堕。 当忆此宫有座席， 此宫谓肺官也。 座席，神之所安。 《中黄经》云：肺首为三焦，玄老君之所居也。 众神合会转相索。 众真同聚，虑有邪精。

yet fear the intrusion of malevolent *qì*."*

chunks.original_text: 隐藏羽盖看天舍， 此明脾官之事。 脾为丹田黄庭，中央戊己，土行也。 上观肝肺，如盖如舍也。 朝拜太阳乐相呼， 谓魂神与众仙合会也。 《素灵经》云：太上神仙有太阳君、少阳君、太虚君、浩素君，群仙宗道之道乐也。 明神八威正辟邪， 八威，八灵神也。 《真语》云：北帝杀鬼咒曰：七正八灵太上皓凶长卢巨数，手把帝钟素臬三神威剑，神王卫法，辟邪之道也。 脾神还归是胃家。 守雌存雄倾三光，脾神名常在，字魂停。 脾磨食消，胃《老子》云：知其雄，守其雌。 雌，家之事也。 《中黄经》云：胃为太牝； 柔弱也。 三光，日月星也。 仓。 太仓，脾府也。 外方内圆神在中。 耽养灵根不复枯， 外方内圆，明堂之象。 脾为黄庭，人命之根本。 心专养之，通利血脉五脏丰，延年神仙也。 闭塞命门保玉都， 元阳子曰：命门者，下丹田，精气入神之处也。 养童下钥护其主。 主，身也。
chunks.translated_text:
「Begin with the hidden *羽盖* [feathered canopy] gazing upon the celestial abode—
this illuminates the affairs of the **Spleen Organ**.

The Spleen is the **Dan Tian** [Elixir Field] and **Huang Ting** [Yellow Court],
the central **Wù-Jǐ** [pentagon hexagram],
the realm of Earth’s cycle.
Above, it oversees the Liver and Lungs,
like a canopy and dwelling.

Morning reverence to the **Tai Yang** [Great Yang] Lord, joyously summoning the spirits—
this refers to the **hun** [ethereal soul] and spirits gathering with the myriad Daoists.
The *Sù Líng Jīng* [Scripture of the Primordial Soul] states:
*"The Supreme Daoists possess the Tai Yang Lord, Shao Yang Lord, Tai Xu Lord, and Hao Su Lord—
the myriad sages follow the Dao’s joyous harmony."*

The **Ming Shen** [Illuminated Spirit] employs the **Eight Threats** to repel malevolence,
the **Eight Threats** being the Eight **Ling Shen** [Spiritual Essences].
The *Zhēn Yǔ* [True Speech] states:
*"The Northern Emperor’s Ghost-Slaying Incantation reads:
Seven Rectitudes, Eight Spirits, Supreme Celestial, Radiant and Malevolent, Long Lu, and the Great Numbers—
handling the Emperor’s Bell, the Primordial *Sù* [unrefined essence], and the Three Divine Threat-Swords,
the God-King’s Protective Law,
the Dao of repelling malevolence.*

The Spleen’s spirit returns to its **Wei Jia** [Stomach Family].
Guarding the **female** while preserving the **male**, tilting toward the **Three Lights** [Sun, Moon, and Stars]—
the Spleen’s spirit is named **Cháng Zài** [Constant Presence],
its character **Hun Tíng** [Soul’s Rest].

chunks.original_text: 身为玉都，神聚其所，犹都邑也。 万神方砟寿有余， 砟，报也。 万神以养见报，故寿余也。 是谓脾建在中宫。 脾王#11中官，土德。 五脏六腑神明王， 以脾为主。 上合天门入明堂， 存五脏六腑之气，上合天门。 天门在两眉问，即天庭是也。 眉问入一寸为明堂。 守雌存雄倾三光， 《老子》云：知其雄，守其雌。 雌，牝； 柔弱也。 三光，日月星也。 外方内圆神在中。 外方内圆，明堂之象。 通利血脉五脏丰， 神恬心静。 骨青筋赤髓如霜， 百豚九窍，皆悉真正。 脾救七窍去不祥， 脾磨食消，耳聪目明。 日月列布设阴阳。 日阳月阴，日男月女。 两神相会化玉浆， 男女阴阳，自然之津液也。 淡然无味天人根， 神虽合会，当味无味。 子丹进僎肴正黄， 候，气也。 子丹真人进丹田之真气。 脾为中黄，脾磨食消也。 乃曰琅膏及玉霜。 津液精气之色象也。 太上隐环八素琼， 谓绛官重楼十二环，即喉咙也。 中有八素之琼液也。 溉益八液肾受精， 咽液流下入肾官，化为玉精也。 伏於太阴见我形， 太阴，洞房。 为睹琼液之形象也。 扬风三玄出始青。 青扬风，感而化也。 阴阳二气与和气为三，三生万物，生物微妙，故日三玄出始青。 言万物生而色青也。 《太平经》曰：积精成青也。 恍惚之间至清灵， 阴阳生气，至微至妙。
chunks.translated_text:
The body is the **Jade Metropolis**, where the spirit gathers—
like a capital city.
The myriad spirits reward longevity with abundance,
for the myriad spirits repay with nourishment—
thus, life is prolonged.

This is called the **Spleen established in the Central Palace**.
The Spleen, as **Middle Official** [#11], embodies **Earth virtue**.
The Five **Zàng** [solid organs] and Six **Fǔ** [hollow organs], divine and sovereign,
take the Spleen as their master.

Above, it aligns with the **Heavenly Gate** to enter the **Ming Tang** [Illuminated Hall],
preserving the **qi** of the Five **Zàng** and Six **Fǔ**—
the **Heavenly Gate** lies between the brows, that is, the **Heavenly Court**.
One inch inward from the **brow junction** is the **Ming Tang**.

Guard the **feminine**, preserve the **masculine**, and incline the **Three Lights** [Sun, Moon, Stars].
As *Laozi* says: *"Know the masculine, guard the feminine."*
**Feminine**—the **vulnerable** [yīn];
**gently yielding** also.
The **Three Lights**—the Sun, Moon, and Stars.
**External square and internal round**, with spirit dwelling within.
**External square and internal round**—the symbols of the **Ming Tang**.
Unimpeded flow of blood vessels and flourishing of the Five **Zàng**,
with spirit serene and heart tranquil.

Bones turn **verdant**, sinews **crimson**, marrow like frost—
the **hundred vessels** and **nine orifices** are all truly authentic.
The Spleen rescues the **seven orifices**, banishing misfortune,
grinding food and aiding digestion—
ears sharp, eyes bright.

The Sun and Moon are arranged, setting **yīn** and **yáng** in order.
The Sun is **yáng**, the Moon is **yīn**—
the Sun is male, the Moon is female.
The two spirits unite, transforming into **Jade Nectar**—
male and female **yīn-yáng**, the natural **essence-fluid**.

Faint and flavorless, the root of **Heaven and Man**,
though spirits unite, one must savor the **flavorless**.

The **True Person of the Child Dan** advances **refined qi**—
**Child Dan**—the **True Person** advances the **true qi** of the **Dan Tian**.
The Spleen, as **Central Yellow**, grinds and digests food.
Thus, it is called **Ling Gāo** [Luminous Paste] and **Yù Shuāng** [Jade Frost]—
the colors of **essence-fluid** and refined **qi**.

The **Taoist Sovereign** conceals the **Eight Pure** [substances] in the **Encircled Pearl**—
referring to the **Twelve-Layered Vermilion Palace** [throat], the **reed pipe** [larynx].
Within are the **Eight Pure** elixirs.
They nourish the **Eight Fluids**, and the **Kidneys** receive the **essence**.

Hidden in the **Great Yīn** [Chamber of Mystery], I behold its form—
**Great Yīn**, the **Cavern Chamber**—
witnessing the form of the **Jade Fluids**.

The **Wind of Exaltation** stirs the **Three Mysteries**, emerging as **Emerald**.
**Emerald Wind**—transformed by sensation.
**Yīn** and **yáng** **qi**, along with the **Harmonious Qi**, make three—
three gives birth to the myriad things, the subtle origin of life—
thus, it is said the **Three Mysteries** emerge as **Emerald**.
Speaking of all things born in **verdant** hue.

*The Taiping Jing* says: *"Accumulating essence yields verdancy."*

In a fleeting moment, it reaches **purity and clarity**—
the **yīn-yáng** vital breath, most subtle and wondrous.

chunks.translated_text:
**Chapter Thirty-Six (continued): Bathing in Ritual Purity**

**Loosening the Hair Without Desire for Longevity**
Loosening the hair, free of **desire**, to prolong existence.
*The Scripture of the Immortals* states: "Before taking the **Nine Clouds of the Lingying Bell***, one must loose the hair."

Again, the **Fetal Breathing Method** instructs:
Lie on your back, loosen the hair, and raise your pillow two and a half inches.
Curl both hands, gripping the **Great Mother Finger** (thumb) firmly,
Close your eyes, extend both arms five inches from the body,
Then **gargle** and fill your mouth.
Hold the **Middle Saliva** (saliva collected in the mouth) and swallow it three times.
Slowly draw in **qi** through the nose,
Inhale **five to six breaths** before exhaling.
One exhalation and one inhalation constitute one **breath**.
When you reach ten exhalations, you may reduce the frequency.
Upon completion, repeat the process.
Filling four times nine (36 times) marks one **session** complete.

Upon examining the text’s meaning,
This "loosening the hair" is not exclusive to this **Dao** alone.
It embodies the **Way** of **wuwei** (non-action), attaining effortless **virtue** through naturalness—
Free from external **emotional desires**.

All five **flavors** return to **Zheng-qi** (pure/true **qi**), merging into one.
This is the **Dao** of nature.

Calm the **heart**, still the **mind**—do not disturb the **Yuan** (source).
**Question**—serenity.
Silent and tranquil stillness.
*The Dao Scripture* says: "Its governance is **questioning**, its people are **pure**."

Having counted the repetitions, the **body’s** **shen** (spirit) and **jing** (essence) are refined,
Focusing the **jing** where it is directed.

chunks.original_text: 黄华玉女告子情， 丹田阴神与己言也。 真人既至使六丁， 真人，指学者身也。 至，谓精至。 六丁，如上说者也。 即授隐芝大洞经。 隐芝，谓隐者也。 以仙人喻芝英。 十读四拜朝太上， 《玉精真诀》曰：《东华玉篇》者，铃十读四拜。 玉篇，谓此文。 先谒太帝后北向， 太帝在束，七元居北故也。 黄庭内经玉书畅。 仙道成矣。 授者日师受者盟， 斯文可重，故以为盟。 云锦凤罗金钮缠， 信誓之物。 以代割发肌肤全， 契诚不假，出血断发。 担手登山敌液丹， 受行黄庭道者，叉重盟而后传。 金书玉景乃可宣。 信洽方授。 传得可授告三官， 三官，天地水也。 勿令七祖受冥患， 传非其人，殃及先世。

The **Dan-tian** (Elixir Field) **yin** (dark) **shen** (spirit) speaks to oneself.

The Six **Ding** are as previously described.

He likens the **sage** to the **Zhi-ying** (herb/plant’s flower).

Then faces north—
The **Taoist Emperor** resides in the **Shu** (constellation), and the **Seven Yuan** (primordial stars) dwell in the north.

The *Yellow Court Inner Scripture* and **Jade Book** are now freely expounded.
The **Dao** of the **sage** is thus perfected.

The instructor’s words are solemn, the recipient’s oath is binding—
This text must be revered, hence the vow.
*"Cloud brocade, phoenix-patterned robes, and golden clasps"* are tokens of faith,
Used in place of cutting the hair or drawing blood to pledge sincerity.

With clasped hands, ascending the mountain to oppose the **Ye** (darkness) **liquid** (elixir),
